Title.En: Responsible Innovation for a Sustainable World

Description.En: The module addresses the concept of responsible innovation—innovations that strive to ethically and sustainably align technological progress with societal needs within planetary boundaries. It covers the potential impacts of innovation, taking into account various ethical and sustainability perspectives. Additionally, the organisation of the innovation process for implementing responsible innovations will be discussed. The module will also examine sustainability from a policy perspective.

NoteLiteral.En: Ability to understand and apply the concept of responsible innovation from different perspectives and contexts
The ability to explain and apply various perspectives to address ethical issues in the innovation process
Ability to explain and apply sustainability principles in an innovation context

PrefLabel.En: evaluate environmental impact of personal behaviour

NoteLiteral.En: Ability to motivate and reflect on the organization of responsible innovation

Title.En: Responsible Innovation for a Sustainable World
Responsible Innovation for a Sustainable World

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
**Teaching and working methods**

Teaching is conducted online through digital meetings.

Teaching formats include lectures, videos, workshops, and individual reflection.

Furthermore, the students are expected to conduct self-studies.

**Assessment**

The module is assessed through:

- Individual written assignment, grading scale: Pass with Distinction (PWD), Pass (P), Fail (F)
- Active participation in digital meetings and workshops, grading scale: Pass (P), Fail (F)

To receive a passing final grade, a minimum of a Pass (P) is required on all components. For a Pass with Distinction (PWD), a Pass with Distinction is required on the individual written assignment.

**Learning pathway suggestion**

This micro-module can be combined with the:

- [The sustainable forest challenge](https://engage.eciu.eu/challenges/eb11dc2c-0bf5-419b-ac84-a4ac6ae29b28/the-sustainable-forest-challenge) (challenge)
- [Business modelling in the circular economy](https://engage.eciu.eu/micro-modules/d0f9524e-fdbe-433e-ae0f-14bc1c57ffb5/business-modelling-in-the-circular-economy) (micro-module)

For any questions, please contact us at eciu@liu.se.
How we can innovate for the better

How can we leverage technological progress to address societal needs and still remain within planetary boundaries? This module explores the concept of responsible innovation and gives the learners the opportunity to apply it in different cases. Join us and learn how we can innovate for the better!

**Deadline for applications:** 14 January 2025 

**Entry requirements**: 90 ECTS completed at the undergraduate level

**Supporting documentation**

All applicants are required to submit a transcript of records.

To process your application we will need the following infromation:

- Name
- Surname
- Legal sex (female/male)
- Date of birth
- Valid home address
- Phone number

This is necessary for the activation of your account at Linköping University and to get access to the study material and the learning management system. Please fill in the above information in your profile on the ECIU engage platform, it will make the process much easier and faster for everyone.

You will receive a results notification within 2 days from the application deadline. If you are admitted, you will be contacted by the host university regarding the next steps in the process.
